messages.content: What does the ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt extension do?

The ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt extension allows the user to save a PNG or JPEG of each image within Comfy and offers an option to save the prompt/workflow in a text or JSON file for each image, along with the capability to disable saving the prompt or previews, and choose a specific folder to save them to.
Can text tokens be used with ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt?
Yes, text tokens can be used with ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt. It includes built-in tokens like [time], [time(format_code)], [hostname], and [user] to format the output file names.
How can I install the ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt extension?

To install the ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt extension, use the command 'git clone https://github.com/mpiquero7164/ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt.git' in your ComfyUI custom nodes directory. After cloning, restart ComfyUI, and the extension will be ready to use.
Which category can I find the ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt node in?
The ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt node can be found in the IO category within ComfyUI.
What is the format of the text tokens for date and time?

The format of the text tokens for date and time is based on Python's strftime directives, where you can specify directives like %a for the day of the week, %d for the day of the month, %m for the month as a zero-padded decimal number, and %Y for the year with century as a decimal number, among others.
Where can I report issues or suggestions regarding the ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt extension?
Issues or suggestions regarding the ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt extension can be reported on the GitHub repository at https://github.com/mpiquero7164/ComfyUI-SaveImgPrompt.
